comment.raw:
/**
 * Replaces circular references, undefined values, and functions with strings. - Circular references are replaced with the string `[Circular ~<path>]` where `<path>` is the path to the circular reference relative to the root object, i.e. `[Circular ~.b.c]`. - `undefined` values are replaced with the string `"undefined"`. - Functions are replaced with the string `"function"`.
 *
 * @returns A replacer function for JSON.stringify.
 */
comment.summary:
Replaces circular references, undefined values, and functions with strings.
- Circular references are replaced with the string `[Circular ~<path>]`
where `<path>` is the path to the circular reference relative to the
root object, i.e. `[Circular ~.b.c]`.
- `undefined` values are replaced with the string `"undefined"`.
- Functions are replaced with the string `"function"`.

comment.raw:
/**
 * JSON.stringify() with circular reference support. - Circular references are replaced with the string `[Circular ~<path>]` where `<path>` is the path to the circular reference. - `undefined` -> `"undefined"` - `function` -> `"function"`
 *
 * @param obj - The object to stringify.
 *
 * @param indentation - Number of spaces for indentation. Optional.
 */
comment.summary:
JSON.stringify() with circular reference support.
- Circular references are replaced with the string `[Circular ~<path>]`
where `<path>` is the path to the circular reference.
- `undefined` -> `"undefined"`
- `function` -> `"function"`

params.name: indentation
params.description: Number of spaces for indentation. Optional.
